questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'acerbic'?
questions.explanation: Acerbic describes harsh or biting tone; 'mild' suggests softened, less harsh expression.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'anodyne' (as an adjective)?
questions.explanation: Anodyne means not likely to offend, bland; 'provocative' means likely to arouse strong reaction.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'antediluvian'?
questions.explanation: Antediluvian means extremely old-fashioned; 'contemporary' means belonging to the present.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'apocryphal'?
questions.explanation: Apocryphal means of doubtful authenticity; 'authentic' means genuine and real.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'concomitant'?
questions.explanation: Concomitant means accompanying or associated; 'unrelated' means having no connection.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'contumacious'?
questions.explanation: Contumacious means stubbornly disobedient, especially to authority; 'compliant' is the institutional opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'exegete' (as a verb, to interpret)?
questions.explanation: To exegete is to explain or interpret clearly; 'obscure' means to make unclear or hard to understand.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'inchoate'?
questions.explanation: Inchoate means just begun, not fully formed; 'fully-formed' is the conceptual opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'jejune' (as in jejune remarks)?
questions.explanation: Jejune remarks are dull or simplistic; 'insightful' remarks show understanding and depth.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'lachrymose'?
questions.explanation: Lachrymose means tearful or inclined to weep; 'jovial' means cheerful and good-humored.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'limpid'?
questions.explanation: Limpid means clear and transparent; 'turbid' means cloudy or muddy.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'mercurial'?
questions.explanation: Mercurial describes rapidly changing moods; 'stable' means not easily changed.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'myopic'?
questions.explanation: Myopic literally means nearsighted; figuratively it means lacking long-term vision; 'far-sighted' directly contrasts.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'neophyte'?
questions.explanation: Neophyte means beginner; 'veteran' means someone experienced in a field.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'obviate'?
questions.explanation: Obviate means to make unnecessary; 'necessitate' means to make something necessary.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'protean'?
questions.explanation: Protean means easily changing or adaptable; 'fixed' means not changing.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'pusillanimous' (again, focusing on nuance)?
questions.explanation: Pusillanimous is cowardly; 'intrepid' emphasizes fearless determination.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'quixotic'?
questions.explanation: Quixotic means idealistic and impractical; 'pragmatic' means focused on practical results.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rebarbative'?
questions.explanation: Rebarbative means unattractive or irritating; 'winsome' means appealing and engaging.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rubicund'?
questions.explanation: Rubicund means reddish and healthy in color; 'pale' is the simplest opposite in complexion.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'soporific' (again, in terms of mental effect)?
questions.explanation: A soporific lecture puts you to sleep; a 'stimulating' one wakes up your brain.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'taciturn' (in personality)?
questions.explanation: Taciturn means habitually silent; 'garrulous' means overly talkative.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'trenchant' (in criticism)?
questions.explanation: Trenchant criticism is sharp and penetrating; 'bland' criticism is mild and dull.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'uxorious'?
